p: Our results shed light on the pseudogap physics. Nematicity in the pseudogap phase is universal regardless of the number of CuO 2 layers per primitive cell. Moreover, the diagonal nematicity in Hg1201, observed in this study for the first time, is associated with the B 2 g representation, in sharp contrast to the CDW order along the bond direction ( B 1 g ), which demonstrates that the nematicity is not a precursor of the CDW. Notice that in other cuprates such as YBCO and Bi 2Sr 2CaCu 2O 8+ Î´ , nematicity and CDW develop along the same bond direction and the precursor issue has not been clear.
